notesStmt.note: Leaves missing after folios 3, 30, 66, 92, 130, 148. Largely defective. Several leaves mutilated.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msItem.title: Perush Seder ḳodashim פרוש סדר קדשים
Perush Seder ṭoharot פרוש סדר טהרות

collation.p: 23 quires: i-xxiii10 (folios 1-205), some of which are defective, signed with Hebrew letters at the end. Folios 206-245, 246-251, 252, 253-254 and 255 are separate fragments of different other manuscripts.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Yemenite semi-cursive script of the 15th century.

binding.p: BM in-house. Spine title: 'Maimonides' Commentary Seder Kodashim. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Oriental 2224.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Moses Wilhelm Shapira (b. 1830, d. 1884), an antiquities dealer of Jerusalem: purchased by the British Museum from him on 10 April 1880: inscribed, folio [256v].
